SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to add new action entries into our database
This is the statement that we use to add user's to an action.
SqlStatement.Sql: insert into useraction (userid, actionid, allow) values ( ?, ?, ? )

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to add group's to an action.
SqlStatement.Sql: insert into groupaction (groupid, actionid, allow) values ( ?, ?, ? )

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to update existing action entries in our database
SqlStatement.Sql: update action set path = ?, okwosession = ? where id = ?

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to delete existing action entries in our database
This is the statement that we use to remove user's from an action
SqlStatement.Sql: delete from useraction where userid = ? and actionid = ?

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to remove group's from an action
SqlStatement.Sql: delete from groupaction where groupid = ? and actionid = ?

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to pull up all action entries in our database
SqlStatement.Sql: select id, path, okwosession from action

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to pull up a single action entry in our database.
SqlStatement.Sql: select id, path, okwosession from action where id = ?

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to pull up a single action entry in our database.
SqlStatement.Sql: select id, path, okwosession from action where path = ?

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to pull up all action entries for a given user in our database based on direct permissions.
SqlStatement.Sql: select id, path, okwosession from action, useraction where useraction.userid = ? and useraction.actionid = action.id and useraction.allow = 1

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to pull up all action entries for a given user in our database based on their group membership permissions.
SqlStatement.Sql: select id, path, okwosession from action, groupaction, usergroup where usergroup.userid = ? and usergroup.groupid = groupaction.groupid and groupaction.actionid = action.id and groupaction.allow = 1

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to check whether a given user has direct permissions to invoke a given action.
SqlStatement.Sql: select id, path, okwosession from action, useraction where useraction.userid = ? and useraction.actionid = action.id and useraction.allow = 1 and action.path = ?

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we to check whether a given user has group permissions to invoke a given action.
SqlStatement.Sql: select id, path, okwosession from action, groupaction, usergroup where usergroup.userid = ? and usergroup.groupid = groupaction.groupid and groupaction.actionid = action.id and groupaction.allow = 1 and action.path = ?
